name: Sohan
experience:
It has been nothing short of exceptional. A unique trait about Lakshya is that both the kids and the volunteers seem to match each other's energy. It has a committed and vibrant community of volunteers that gladly accepted me as one of their own.

Teaching here has been very fulfilling, and I could see a marked improvement in speech, writing, and language usage with my kids. On the last day, my kids ran up to me with a thank-you note they had prepared, which they sang in unison. After that, one of them broke down in tears and said she had never had a teacher like me.

A moving revelation that Lakshya gave me was that even the few hours of a busy week that I've been putting in could mean a great deal to someone else.

name: Prerana
experience:
One of the most fulfilling aspects of my experience at Lakshya was witnessing the transformation in students' confidenceâ€”from struggling with basic concepts to actively participating in discussions. I also encouraged critical thinking and problem-solving, equipping them with skills beyond the classroom.

The community has been incredibly supportive and welcoming, making it feel like a second home. Beyond the classroom, the bonds formed through after-class outings, volunteer bonding sessions, and shared experiences have been truly special. Whether it was getting to know fellow volunteers, organizing events like the Science Fair, End-of-Year celebrations, and Christmas festivities, or simply spending time at Lakshya, every moment has been filled with joy and fulfillment. The warmth of this community has made my journey at U&I not just about volunteering but about belonging, growing, and creating lasting memories.

Forever grateful for this experience.

name: Aneesh
experience:
Out of many things that I loved about my experience in U&I, the one that really stood out to me, was its inclusivity and that connection that I felt not only to the kids but with my fellow volunteers. They somehow created this environment of passion and freeness along with a good mix of fun. Activities throughout the year made me really push my social muscles and, in turn, have some of the best conversations I have had thus far.

I received and was able to garner multiple perspectives; by knowing each one of them, I was able to give way for my own growth and personal development.

name: Neha
experience:
I loved my experience with Lakshya! And frankly speaking, initially when I joined, I was hesitant. If I'll be able to make up time every week, and if I'll be a good teacher. And if you're feeling the exact same way now, TRUST ME, it's a part of the process.

My days spent at Lakshya feel like home. Interacting with the kids, watching them grow through the months, playing games with them, and becoming a child again around them - you are going to love every bit of it.

If I still have not sold you this, Lakshya apart from teaching, also has amazing community-building activities. You're going to meet like-minded people you can chill with, learn from, and bond over crazy stuff.

On weekends, whether you're busy or free, Lakshya is the place to be <3

name: Sanjana
experience:
When I first joined Lakshya, I was skeptical. Teaching kids with little to no background in English felt daunting, especially when I realized they hadnâ€™t been exposed to parts of speech, tenses, or even basic spellingsâ€”despite being in high school. The learning gap was significant, and overcoming it took time, patience, and countless revisions. But today, when I look back, I see real progress. Theyâ€™ve grown, theyâ€™ve improved, and knowing that I played a part in that transformation fills me with joy.

Initially, I joined with the intention of â€˜giving back to society,â€™ but I stayed for the people. I still remember the first few days when I wanted to leave the center as soon as classes ended, avoiding debriefs and small talk. But over time, that changed. Moments like Childrenâ€™s Day, where a simple game of guessing childhood pictures turned into unexpected fun, made me realize how much I enjoyed being part of this community. I started staying back, made new friends, and found a sense of belonging. I wonâ€™t say I connect with everyone equally, but Iâ€™ve met some truly good people here, and thatâ€™s something Iâ€™ll always cherish.

Christmas was another highlight. The amount of planning, effort, and teamwork that went into making it a success was incredible. And seeing the kidsâ€™ happiness? That was the icing on the cake.

But everything was not perfect, as it rarely is. Here are some things I noticed: Leadership works best when shared, ensuring no one is overburdened. Titles should come with commitment and accountability, with leaders actively contributing. While volunteer efforts vary, recognizing dedication and encouraging collective responsibility will strengthen the center.

Yet, despite the challenges, weâ€™ve achieved so much togetherâ€”whether it was pulling off incredible events, organizing an unforgettable Christmas, or driving successful crowdfunding efforts.

For all of thisâ€”for the growth, the impact, the friendships, and the lessonsâ€”I am grateful. Lakshya has given me experiences I will carry forward, and I leave this year knowing that, in many ways, it has shaped me as much as Iâ€™ve helped shape it.

name: Varshitha
experience: Lakshya, as a community center, did an incredible job in creating a supportive environment for the kids. The leaders ensured that the kids were present every Saturday, making learning a consistent part of their routine. My journey as a volunteer was truly wholesome, and the most beautiful part was being able to teach my kids and support them in every way possible. It wasnâ€™t just about studies; there was fun and excitement involved too. The team constantly encouraged the kids to participate in activities and always came up with innovative ideas to keep them engaged. The celebrations were the highlight of the season, making the experience even more memorable.

name: Ram
experience:
It all started on July 7th when I was added to the Lakshya Group â€” yeah, the name was decided later, but still. I was kind of in a dilemma about whether to continue, and I had a ton of questions running through my mind: How many people would be there? Will they judge me? What if I get nervous?â€” because honestly, I was pretty scared of crowds. But then I thought, *Chalo, jo hoga dekha jayega*.

Then came July 13th â€” our first official icebreaker session. I was near Mathruchhaya, waiting for someone to show up, when I saw Tejas and Tia walking towards me. I recognized Tejas, and after the usual *Hello, how are you* stuff, the class and debrief went surprisingly well. Thatâ€™s also the day I saw a 10th-grade kid who didnâ€™t know any grammar at all. I remember thinking, *How come anta?* But again, *Chalo, jo hoga dekha jayega* â€” and I just moved on.  

I even remember mentioning during my interview that my class should be completely digital. Kids remember what they see more than what they hear, right? But here, it was the opposite â€” we werenâ€™t allowed to use phones or laptops unless absolutely necessary. I was clueless about what to do next. Then I remembered my PU days, when my lecturers would give us printed notes. I borrowed that approach, and it worked like magic with my kids.

As days passed, Lakshya became more of a family than just a group of college students trying to help kids. In the early days, I used to rush off right after the debriefs, but now we spend hours together even after class. That constant feeling of *Ghar jaake kya hi karenge, idhar rukha toh ye kamine log honge, kuch bakchodi hoga* (*Whatâ€™s the point of going home when I could just stay back and have fun with these idiots*) remains unchanged!

I knew I had done something meaningful when I received the *Outstanding Teacher Award*. I still remember asking, *Me? Aaaâ€¦?* â€” not once, but three times when they called my name. That moment is permanently imprinted in my brain cells.

I thought Lakshya would be more of a tutoring program, but it turned out to be so much more â€” especially during *Children's Day x Christmas*. That event was such a success that even leaders from across Bangalore showed up to cheer us on. Lakshya became a brand â€” a benchmark â€” and people started recognizing that our volunteers were something special.

Then I was chosen as a coach for crowdfunding. Initially, I thought it would be pretty simple, but it turned out to be tough. Managing a group of people with busy schedules and getting them to participate in crowdfunding activities wasnâ€™t easy. Not every volunteer had the same level of enthusiasm, but thankfully, some stepped up and took responsibility at just the right time.

I joined U&I with the intention of teaching on Saturdays and heading home afterward. But it turned out so differently. I met people from other centers, found another place that feels like home, and made more friends I now consider family. I got a great teaching buddy, an always-dependable friend, and even a *Rotighar hogana* (*Letâ€™s go for food*) friend! More than I could have ever imagined.

Like, who would have thought that a TL could be so sweet, approving everything I say? It feels amazing when people open up about their daily lives and get excited to meet each other every week. The leaders have done an incredible job â€” not just with the classes but in creating a genuine comfort zone for all of us. Hats off to them for having such patience and understanding every volunteer in such a short time.

I canâ€™t believe itâ€™s already ending. Eight months went by way too fast. Itâ€™s true what they say â€” *Itâ€™s pretty scary how quickly time flies.*â¤ï¸

name: Sanjana
experience:
As a first-time teacher volunteer, my heart is full when I look back at my journey in Lakshya. There were so many reasons to show up every single week at the center. The kids, volunteers, and leaders made this whole journey exciting. When I joined, I did not know the rollercoaster of emotions I would experience by the end of it. Every person I have met has been welcoming, and every interaction with someone brought me closer to the community and what we were able to do together as Lakshya.

The enthusiasm of the kids to learn more and their expectation for you to show up every week, because they do too, makes you never want to miss a class. Every event that took place at the center brought the volunteers closer, irrespective of their backgrounds. Over time, a space was created where you could share your perspective without feeling judged, which really impressed me.

Speaking from my experience and after listening to fellow volunteers, I understood that you are in for a journey of self-growth. Another thing to appreciate about the center is its leaders. Every leader brought their strengths to the table and made sure to keep the community engaging and fun at all times. The overall atmosphere was always warm and approachable, which made a huge difference. I never hesitated to ask for support when I needed it. The leaders were constantly coming up with creative ways to engage the kids, which opened up our perspectives.

Creative teaching was something new for many of us, so this push helped us step out of our comfort zones and try fresh, innovative approaches. Looking back, it was this encouragement that made all the difference, shaping us into more confident and adaptable volunteers.

Looking back at everything, I now realize how much this experience has shaped me. The encouragement, the sense of belonging, and the friendships I built here made all the difference. Lakshya has given me so much more than I ever expected, and I will always be grateful for every moment I have spent here. My time at the center will always hold a special place in my heart, and I know that these memories, the lessons I have learned, and the people I have met will stay with me for the rest of my life.

name: Manasi
experience:
So the day I joined Lakshya, it was honestly the most wholesome day ever, and the fact that I had never experienced teaching someone before made me wild and excited. I was very nervous about how I would impart knowledge to someone.

 Next week, I was mapped to 2 kids, and I thought it would be a really big responsibility. We started out, and the kids were shy at first but started opening up to me. They shared their school life, their family life, and at the end of the class, they told me that if they had a choice, they would come to Lakshya every day just to be taught by the volunteers here, and not go to school at all. That made me so happy, and it's a cherishable memory that I will hold forever. â¤

name: Adhithya
experience:
Volunteering at Lakshya was a truly special and unique experience.

It's a small dream come true moment for me. I enjoyed my volunteering journey at Lakshya mainly because of my fellow volunteers and kids.

It has helped me to learn many valuable life skills.

name: Anudeep
experience:
My experience as a volunteer at U&I was truly soulful and deeply meaningful.

The warmth and love I received from fellow volunteers, along with the way the kids looked up to me, made it incredibly special.

Through this journey, I grew as a person and became a better version of myself. Looking back at how things have unfolded this year, I feel proud of taking on this commitment.

I'm truly grateful for the people I met, the kids I got to connect with, and the opportunity to make a difference.

name: Prerna
experience:
It was an amazing experience!

Honestly, when I first came in, it was just with an incentive of teaching the kids and then going back home. But the kind of connect I made with the kids I was teaching, the other volunteers, and even my leadersâ€”it was just like a blessing.

I learned so many new things, not just about teaching but also about myself. I often found myself teaching the kids in a way I would have liked to learn things, and I was unaware of that for a long time.

And in time, U&I became a very important part of my life. In all, if I ever had a chance to relive my experience here at Lakshya, I would happily be a part of it again :))

name: Shraddha
experience: I had been absolutely wanting to do this since forever and when I found out about U&I it felt perfect! The best part is it became better than i imagined because of the community overall.

name: Sinchana
experience:
When I first heard about Lakshya during my collegeâ€™s session, I knew I had to be a part of it. The idea of teaching kids, guiding them, and celebrating special moments together felt like something I truly wanted to experience.

Ever since joining, Saturdays have become the highlight of my weekâ€”I look forward to meeting the kids, engaging in fun and meaningful learning, and being surrounded by their excitement and curiosity.

Every session brings new experiences, challenges, and moments of joy, making my journey with Lakshya incredibly fulfilling. Itâ€™s not just about teaching; itâ€™s about creating bonds, sharing happiness, and growing together.

name: Skanda
experience:
My journey at Lakshya has been one of exponential growth. I still remember the first few days of the introverted me refraining from speaking to any of our fellow volunteers. But today, I can definitely claim to be one of the budding wizards of people skills, all thanks to the right set of leaders and peers that gave me the push and much-needed support at the right time.

It was not until I took up the responsibility of cracking up the audience at the Parent-Teacher Meet of the year, somewhere around October in a career fair at our center, that I addressed a crowd of 40+ people after a long while. I received an overwhelming response and appreciation from my fellow volunteers and leaders.

Later on, I was assigned the role of a coach for the whole crowdfunding season and the facilitator of the LC calls whenever my leader, Ria, had other commitments to take care of. My heartfelt thanks to her and other leaders (especially Tejas) for guiding me through this journey, which has built me to the heights that I am at.

I am still not able to get over the fact that this year has come to an end. It was a beautiful and sweet year, thanks to the environment created by the right set of people that our center hasâ€”from the volunteers to the chapter heads and the manager. This feeling of being valued and recognized is what creates a sense of community, belonging, and strong bonds with our peers!!

name: Michael
experience:
I recently joined Lakshya and can comfortably tell it is one of the most amazing experiences that I have felt. Even though I was new to the team and community, the members did not make me feel like I was new and helped me get on the journey smoothly. The team is fun, amazing, and proactive. This is a very good learning experience, and I want more people to experience it.

Just a small bit of my experience is, towards the end of the first class with my kid, he told me that he wanted to do something else, and I suggested, 'Let's read a story.'

We opened a book about pirates and treasure (it was a very interactive book). We had big smiles on our faces after reading the story and getting immersed in its characters.

The day ended with him telling me, 'Let us read another story next class,' with a Hi5.

name: Divya
experience:
Lakshya was a fresh experience for me. Although I had never been a part of crowdfunding before, I had an amazing experience teaching the kids at Lakshya. Every week, I would get a different child to teach, which allowed me to interact with various young minds and understand their unique perspectives.

Even though I have been a part of Lakshya for only five weeks, I already have so many cherished moments. I am looking forward to continuing my journey here and creating even more beautiful memories!

name: Tejas
experience:
From the very beginning, Lakshya felt like something special :) When we started back in July, I knew it had the potential to be impactful, but I wasnâ€™t sure how everything would come together. We were a new center, with all new set of volunteers, leaders and kids. Managing volunteers, ensuring smooth operations, and creating a lasting impact on the kids felt like a big responsibility. 'Could we actually do it all?' I felt doubt if I could balance it alongside my other commitments.

But then, something amazing happened; as the first month passed, the team came together in the most natural way possible. We weren't just a group of individuals meeting once a week for 2 hours; it became something more. A support system that made every success even more rewarding. The energy and passion of everyone around me didnâ€™t just motivate me, it made me WANT to do more. I didnâ€™t just want to fulfill my role; I wanted to go beyond, to push boundaries, and to bring everything I had to the table for Lakshya ðŸ”¥.

Looking back, I can say with certainty. Agreeing to this was the best decision I have taken till date :) The fun we had, the connections we built, and, most importantly, the impact we created together on the kids made every bit of effort worth it. Leading Lakshya wasnâ€™t just about running a center; it was about being part of something bigger, something that will stay with me long after my time here ends.

name: Pranavjeet
experience:
When I first joined the Lakshya program, Iâ€™ll admit I was a bit skeptical. I wondered if the center could truly create a meaningful impact on the kidsâ€”and whether Iâ€™d be able to contribute in a way that mattered. But from the very beginning, starting with my interview, my doubts began to fade.

Every experience since then has been one high after another. Meeting the passionate leaders behind the program showed me that this was a group of incredible people, all driven by a shared purposeâ€”to make a real difference. That alone was enough to convince me that this journey was going to be something special.

Each class feels like its own rewarding experience. The post-class debriefs with the entire Lakshya team, and the more focused discussions within the LIFT group, constantly reinforce the feeling that we arenâ€™t just volunteersâ€”weâ€™re a family.

Looking back, joining Lakshya has easily been one of the best decisions Iâ€™ve made this year. The impact, the connections, and the sense of belonging have been truly unforgettable.

name: Priyanka
experience: My experience at Lakshya is unexplainable. I have made a very good friend and memories with everyone. It helped me to actually grow as a person. In fact, I have learnt many things from both the kids and the volunteers. I felt very happy whenever I met the kids. Sometimes their happiness, confidence and love didn't allow me to leave Lakshya. Now U&I and Lakshya feel like home. I can open up with anyone without being judged. Grateful for all the lessons and memories. I will cherish it forÂ veryÂ longÂ time.

name: Renisa
experience:
To put it very simply U&I has been magical. The level of dedication and team work I have seen here and have had the privilege to be a part of is unprecedented. And it comes with the sweetest reward ever- watching the joy on children's faces! 

Teaching here has been so rewarding personally and helped me build so much as a person emotionally. I might have joined U&I to teach but I definitely ended up beingÂ theÂ oneÂ taught.

name: Ria
experience:
Lakshya has been nothing short of magical âœ¨ From starting a new center to making a loud and proud impact in Bangalore ðŸŽ‰, this journey has been a true team effort And finding this incredible bunch of fellowmates? That has been nothing less than a blessing ðŸ™Œ.

 But it wasnâ€™t just about us volunteers, but it was about the kids too â¤. Witnessing their growth has been one of the most heartfelt experiences. And the best part? It wasnâ€™t just one or two, every child had their own journey and their own story of progress. We taught them but in return they taught us so much more. They showed us how to be loving â¤, caring ðŸ¤—, present ðŸŽ­, resilient ðŸ’ª, patient ðŸ§˜â€â™‚ and endlessly curious ðŸ¤©.

 Teaching two subjects was just a part of it. What truly mattered was the transformation we saw in them. Their growth, their confidence, and their joy made every moment worthwhile ðŸ’–. 

 This year, this journey and this experience will always be a memory to cherishÂ foreverÂ âœ¨

name: Anagha
experience:
Being a part of Lakshya has been one of the most heartwarming and fulfilling experiences of my life. From the very first day, I felt a deep sense of belonging, surrounded by a community that genuinely cared. Every Saturday became something to look forward toâ€”a day filled with laughter, learning, and the simple joys of being together. 

It wasnâ€™t just about teaching; it was about watching these kids grow, helping them believe in themselves, and celebrating their little victories along the way. The energy they brought, their endless curiosity, and the way their eyes lit up when they learned something new made every moment worth it. 

Lakshya wasnâ€™t just a learning spaceâ€”it was a place where creativity flourished, where every activity was designed to spark excitement and engagement. Whether it was a fun game, an interactive lesson, or a festival celebration, the joy in the room was contagious. But the best part? The connections. The bonds built over time, the trust we shared, and the moments of pure happiness we created together. Itâ€™s hard to put into words how much this journey has meant to me, but one thing is certainâ€”Lakshya will always hold a special place in my heart.
